'''Breloom''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''キノガッサ''' ''Kinogassa'') is a dual-type {{2t|Grass|Fighting}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Shroomish}} starting at [[level]] 23.

==Biology==
Breloom is a bipedal, mushroom-like Pokémon with some kangaroo-like qualities. Most of its body is green, but its head to its neck and its tail are beige. On top of its head is a green, mushroom-like cap with beige gills underneath and a round, red berry-like growth with a hole in the middle on either side. It has oval, black eyes, a beak-like mouth, and frilled segments around the base of its neck. There are two red claws on each of its hands and feet. At the end of its tail, there are seed clusters made of hardened toxic spores that are horrible to eat.

Breloom can stretch its short arms to deliver fast punches. Additionally, it has light, springy footwork that allows it to get close to opponents. Another way it closes in on opponents is by incapacitating them with spores released from the holes in its cap. Its technique is equal to that of professional boxers. It prefers to live in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|warm and humid forests,}} where it feeds on trees and plants.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Breloom anime.png|thumb|250px|left|Breloom in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
Breloom appeared in ''[[AG082|A Shroomish Skirmish]]'', where they attacked {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} after [[Evolution|evolving]] from Shroomish and were furious at {{TRT}} for stealing their {{pkmn|food}}. {{an|May}}'s newly evolved {{TP|May|Combusken}} took on the leader Breloom in a vicious hand-to-hand fight and suddenly declared a truce between them, saving the day.

{{si|Kenny}} has a Breloom that debuted in ''[[DP060|Journey to the Unown!]]'', where it was used in {{pkmn|battle}} against [[Ash's Turtwig]]. In ''[[DP061|Team Shocker!]]'', its performance in the [[Appeal|Appeals Round]] of the [[Solaceon Town]] [[Pokémon Contest]] advanced Kenny to the [[Contest Battle]]s.

A wild male Breloom appeared in ''[[XY104|A Windswept Encounter!]]''. He was in love with an Orange Flower {{p|Floette}} and had three {{p|Beedrill}} followers. He fought against {{AP|Noibat}} over the Floette, who didn't reciprocate his feelings, but later worked together with Noibat to defeat {{TRT}}.

====Minor appearances====
Breloom debuted in a cameo in ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''. The Mushroom Pokémon was one of the residents of [[Forina]], {{OBP|Jirachi|M06}}'s home.

A Breloom appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[AG102|Where's Armaldo?]]''.

A Breloom had a cameo in ''[[AG135|Numero Uno Articuno]]'' as a Pokémon belonging to {{FB|Factory Head|Noland}}.

A Breloom appeared in ''[[AG145|Pasta La Vista!]]'', under the ownership of the [[Fighting Dojo]].

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Breloom briefly appeared in ''[[AG180|May, We Harley Drew'd Ya!]]''.

A Breloom was battled by [[Ash's Pikachu]] during the tournament held in [[Rota]] in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

Multiple Breloom made a cameo in the opening sequence of ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

Multiple Breloom appeared in ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]'' as some of the many local Pokémon living in [[Crown City]]. Two of them worked with the other Pokémon in surrounding {{OBP|Zorua|M13}} with the intention of attacking him, angry for what {{OBP|Zoroark|M13}} did to the city. Before a fight broke out, the Breloom, along with the other Pokémon, were calmed down by {{OBP|Celebi|M13}}.

A Breloom appeared in ''[[SS026|Mewtwo — Prologue to Awakening]]''.

A group of Breloom appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'', where they battled the [[Genesect Army]] at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Breloom appeared in a video that [[Sawyer]] was watching during ''[[XY129|Kalos League Passion with a Certain Flare!]]'' during a fight with a {{p|Scrafty}}.

===In Pokémon Generations===
[[File:Ninjask Breloom Masquerain PG.png|thumb|250px|Breloom in [[Pokémon Generations]]]]
A wild Breloom appeared in ''[[PG08|The Cavern]]'', where it was running away from a storm which a [[Primal Reversion|Primal]] {{p|Kyogre}} was creating.
{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Masaharu Breloom Adventures.png|thumb|220px|Breloom in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Breloom made its debut in ''[[PS185|Brushing Past Breloom]]'' where a wild one attacked [[Norman]], only to be quickly beaten unconscious by his {{p|Vigoroth}}'s {{m|Aerial Ace}}.

It also made a brief appearance in ''[[PS320|Verily Vanquishing Vileplume II]]'' under the ownership of {{tc|Pokémon Ranger}} Masaharu. However, it was no match for {{adv|Emerald}}'s {{p|Dusclops}}.

The Battle Factory rented a Breloom which was stolen by [[Guile Hideout]] in ''[[PS334|The Final Battle VII]]''.

A Breloom appeared in a flashback as a Pokémon trained by the [[International Police]] in ''[[PS528|Innocent Scientist]]''.
{{-}}

==Trivia==
* Breloom and its {{p|Shroomish|pre-evolved form}} share their species name with {{p|Paras}}, {{p|Parasect}}, {{p|Foongus}}, and {{p|Amoonguss}}. They are all known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

===Origin===
Breloom is based on a {{wp|mushroom}} specifically the genus {{wp|Agaricus}} and its body structure resembles that of a {{wp|kangaroo}}. The shapes of its head and tail resemble that of the armored {{wp|dinosaurs}}, ''{{wp|Pachycephalosaurus}}'' and ''{{wp|Ankylosaurus}}'', respectively.

====Name origin====
Breloom may be a combination of ''{{wp|umbrella}}'' and ''{{wp|mushroom}}''. In Latin, ''bellum'' means ''war'', perhaps a nod to its Fighting type.

Kinogassa may be a combination of 茸 ''kinoko'' (mushroom) and 傘 ''kasa'' (umbrella).
